---
title: "101 Run app"
---


::: {.callout-note collapse="false"}
## Exercise
Run the "app" below to launch an HTML based user interface that contains the app's contents.
:::


::::: {.column-screen-inset}
::: {.panel-tabset}
## Goal
```{shinylive-python}
#| standalone: true
#| components: [viewer]
#| layout: horizontal
#| viewerHeight: 800
from shiny.express import ui

# To run the app, click the play button (a triangle) located 
# above to the right.

"""
Why Shiny for Python? Shiny lets you make pure Python web apps 
quickly, without worrying about cache, state, callbacks ...or 
even HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
"""

## file: requirements.txt
pandas
plotly
```
## Problem
```{shinylive-python}
#| standalone: true
#| components: [editor, viewer]
#| layout: horizontal
#| viewerHeight: 800
from shiny.express import ui

"""
Why Shiny for Python? Shiny lets you make pure Python web apps 
quickly, without worrying about cache, state, callbacks ...or 
even HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
"""



## file: requirements.txt
pandas
plotly
```
## Solution
```{shinylive-python}
#| standalone: true
#| components: [editor, viewer]
#| layout: horizontal
#| viewerHeight: 800
from shiny.express import ui

# To run the app, click the play button (a triangle) located 
# above to the right.

"""
Why Shiny for Python? Shiny lets you make pure Python web apps 
quickly, without worrying about cache, state, callbacks ...or 
even HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
"""

## file: requirements.txt
pandas
plotly
```

The source code for this exercise is [here](https://github.com/posit-conf-2024/intro-to-shiny-for-python/tree/main/problem).
